title: cannot relate bound region

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code ```Rust use std::collections::HashSet; fn calc_edges<'a>(stages: Vec>) { stages .into_iter() .map(|stage: &Stage| -> Vec { stage .next_stages .into_iter() .enumerate() .map(|(index, next_stage)| { let next_stage_vertex_index = stages .into_iter() .position(|stage| stage.identifier == next_stage.identifier); (index, next_stage_vertex_index) }) .collect::>() }) .flatten() .collect() } struct Stage<'a> { identifier: String, next_stages: HashSet<&'a Stage<'a>>, } type Edge = (usize, Option); ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.68.1 (8460ca823 2023-03-20) binary: rustc commit-hash: 8460ca823e8367a30dda430efda790588b8c84d3 commit-date: 2023-03-20 host: x86_64-pc-windows-msvc release: 1.68.1 LLVM version: 15.0.6 ``` ### Error output ``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box', /rustc/8460ca823e8367a30dda430efda790588b8c84d3\compiler\rustc_errors\src\lib.rs:987:33 ```
Backtrace
